entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Saturday... Confidence is increasing that a marine layer will develop along the coast through the weekend. This could cause daytime high temperatures to be lower than areas who do not see the marine layer develop. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures Will Bring Rises to the Taiya River... As temperatures warm into the upper 70s and even low 80s on Friday, increased snow melt and glacial runoff will cause the Taiya River to rise. There still exist some uncertainty on how high the river could rise, but it is expected to remain within its banks. Looking into the weekend, there will still be warm temperatures in

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 11:57AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Warming Temperatures through Sunday... There is a high potential for near record high temperatures soaring into the upper 70s and 80s throughout the Panhandle starting Thursday and continuing through Sunday. Friday will be the warmest day with a greater than 80 percent chance of communities seeing greater than 75 degrees. Warmest temperatures will occur
entry.cap:areaDesc: Admiralty Island; City and Borough of Juneau; City and Borough of Wrangell; City of Hyder; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:12PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Tuscaloosa, southern Pickens, northern Greene and northwestern Sumter Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 412 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles southeast of Ashcraft Corner to Johnston Lake to Paulette. Movement was southeast at 15 mph.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:04PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Morgan and southeastern Lawrence Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 403 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brushy Lake, or 9 miles south of Moulton, moving east at 10 mph. This thunderstorm is producing frequent lightning, if thunder roars, go indoors!

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued July 06 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL ASHLEY COUNTY IN SOUTHEASTERN ARKANSAS AND NORTHERN MOREHOUSE PARISHES IS CANCELLED... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning has been cancelled.
